pattern: {"platform": "linux", "description": "ATT&CK: T1059,T1169,T1206,T1025,T1052", "queries": {"linux_sudoers": {"query": "select * from sudoers;", "interval": 3600, "description": "Linux sudoers information - ATT&CK T1169,T1206"}, "linux_setuid": {"query": "select * from suid_bin;", "interval": 3600, "description": "List linux files that are setuid-enabled"}, "linux_sudoers_shell": {"query": "SELECT * FROM processes WHERE cmdline LIKE '/bin/bash -i >& /dev/tcp/%';", "interval": 3600, "description": "Check any bash reverse shell forwarded to the attacker - ATT&CK T1169,T1206"}, "linux_sudoers_sha1": {"query": "SELECT hash.sha1, fi.path, fi.filename, datetime(fi.btime, 'unixepoch', 'UTC') as btime, datetime(fi.atime, 'unixepoch', 'UTC') as atime, datetime(fi.ctime, 'unixepoch', 'UTC') as ctime, datetime(fi.mtime, 'unixepoch', 'UTC') as mtime FROM hash JOIN file fi USING (path) where (fi.path like '/etc/sudoers') AND type='regular';", "interval": 3600, "description": "Check any bash reverse shell forwarded to the attacker - ATT&CK T1169,T1206"}, "linux_mounts": {"query": "SELECT device, device_alias, flags, path,type from mounts;", "interval": 600, "description": "Check mount on the host - ATT&CK T1025,T1052"}, "usb_devices": {"query": "SELECT * FROM usb_devices;", "interval": 3600, "description": "Check USB device on the host - ATT&CK T1052"}}, "name": "generic_linux"}
